hints.content:
We can turn the rule into numbers and math symbols:

Rule: $\maroonD{\text{Multiply }} \blueD x \maroonD{\text{ by 2}}$.  Then $\greenD{\text{add 5}}$ to the result to get $\goldD y$.

$\blueD x \maroonD{\times 2} \greenD{+5} = \goldD y$

Now we can use the rule to  complete the  table: 

$x$ | |$y$ 
:-: | :-: 
$\blueD0$ |  $\blueD0 \maroonD{\times2}\greenD{+5} =  \goldD5$ | $\goldD5$
$\blueD1$ |  $\blueD1 \maroonD{\times2}\greenD{+5} =  \goldD7$  | $\goldD7$
$\blueD2$ | $\blueD2 \maroonD{\times2}\greenD{+5} =  \goldD9$ |$\goldD9$

Each pair of $x$ and $y$ values in the table represents an ordered pair and a point on the graph. 

The ordered pairs are:  $(0, 5), (1, 7),$ and $(2, 9)$.

Now let's graph each point.

Each $x$ value represents a number on the horizontal axis.

Each $y$ value represents a number on the vertical axis.

To graph the point $(\blueD0,\goldD5)$, go right on the $x$-axis $\blueD0$ spaces and up on the $y$-axis $\goldD5$ spaces.


[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled 0 through 10 on the x-axis and the y-axis. An arrow moves 5 units up the y-axis from the origin. A point appears at the end of the arrow.

hints.content:
To graph the point $(\blueD1,\goldD7)$, go right on the $x$-axis $\blueD1$ space and up on the $y$-axis $\goldD7$ spaces.



[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled 0 through 10 on the x-axis and the y-axis. A point is plotted 5 units up from the origin on the y-axis. A blue arrow moves right 1 unit from the origin to the 1 on the x-axis. An orange arrow moves 7 units up from the 1 on the x-axis to align with 7 on the y-axis. A point appears at the end of the orange arrow.

hints.content:
To graph the point $(\blueD2,\goldD9)$, go right on the $x$-axis $\blueD2$ spaces and up on the $y$-axis $\goldD9$ spaces.



[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled 0 through 10 on the x-axis and the y-axis. A point is plotted 5 units up from the origin on the y-axis. A second point is plotted 1 unit to the right and 7 units up from the origin. A blue arrow moves right 2 units from the origin on to the 2 on the x-axis. An orange arrow moves 9 units up from the 2 on the x-axis to align with the 9 on the y-axis. A point appears at the end of the orange arrow.

hints.content:
Here are the completed table and graph:

$x$ | $y$ 
:-: | :-: 
$0$ | $5$
$1$ |  $7$
$2$ |  $9$



[[☃ image 1]]
